cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, or 275 mi ENE of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northeast through early Saturday, then slow and turn westward, meandering toward the central/upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to upper Texas coast (roughly between Corpus Christi and Galveston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued − interests along the western Gulf Coast advised to monitor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western and north-central Gulf Coast from the Mexican state of Tamaulipas northward to the Texas and Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests <4 inches for southeast Louisiana)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy periods with occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible in outer bands late weekend into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected for the Mississippi River Delta; highest surge threat remains along the Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain to the New Orleans area Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher than normal seas across the north-central Gulf
